meanings.definition: A stiff, open-weave fabric used for stiffening garments.
meanings.sent1: The dressmaker used tarletans to stiffen the collar of the dress.
meanings.sent2: She bought a beautiful dress made of tarletans fabric.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the tarletans, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as firm as tarletans, never wavering.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the delicate tarletans, casting a soft glow.

meanings.definition: A garment made of tarletans fabric.
meanings.sent1: She wore a lovely tarletans dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer showcased a collection of tarletans garments.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pretended to be superheroes in their tarletans capes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as the shimmering tarletans gown.
meanings.sent5: The dancer twirled gracefully in her flowing tarletans skirt.

meanings.definition: To stiffen or make stiff with tarletans fabric.
meanings.sent1: The tailor tarletansed the hem of the skirt to give it a crisp edge.
meanings.sent2: She carefully tarletansed the cuffs of the shirt for a polished look.
meanings.sent3: The chef tarletansed the pie crust to ensure it held its shape.
meanings.sent4: His resolve was tarletansed by the challenges he faced.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages were tarletansed with age, fragile and yellowed.
